cards.name: Soltari Priest
cards.text:
Protection from red
Shadow (This creature can block or be blocked by only creatures with shadow.)
cards.flavor: "In Rath," the priest said, "there is even greater need for prayer."

cards.name: Harbinger of the Hunt
cards.text:
Flying
{2}{R}: Harbinger of the Hunt deals 1 damage to each creature without flying.
{2}{G}: Harbinger of the Hunt deals 1 damage to each other creature with flying.
cards.flavor: An Atarka dragon's exhale cooks what its inhale consumes.

rulings.text: If Harbinger of the Hunt loses flying, its first activated ability will cause it to deal damage to itself.

cards.originalText:
Flying
{2}{R}: Harbinger of the Hunt deals 1 damage to each creature without flying.
{2}{G}: Harbinger of the Hunt deals 1 damage to each other creature with flying.

cards.name: Sarcomancy
cards.text:
When Sarcomancy enters the battlefield, create a 2/2 black Zombie creature token.
At the beginning of your upkeep, if there are no Zombies on the battlefield, Sarcomancy deals 1 damage to you.
cards.originalText:
When Sarcomancy enters the battlefield, put a 2/2 black Zombie creature token onto the battlefield.
At the beginning of your upkeep, if there are no Zombies on the battlefield, Sarcomancy deals 1 damage to you.

cards.name: Denizen of the Deep
cards.text: When Denizen of the Deep enters the battlefield, return each other creature you control to its owner's hand.
cards.originalText: When Denizen of the Deep comes into play, return all other creatures you control from play to their owner's hand.

cards.name: Millstone
cards.text: {2}, {T}: Target player puts the top two cards of their library into their graveyard.
cards.flavor: More than one mage was driven insane by the sound of the Millstone relentlessly grinding away.

rulings.text: Can be used on a player with less than 2 cards in their library. It will remove 0 or 1 cards if that is all that is available.
It is not a draw effect so it will not cause a player with less than 2 cards in their library to lose.
Since you are putting more than one card in the graveyard at one time, the affected player can choose the order the 2 cards go in.

cards.originalText: {2}, {T}: Take the top two cards from target player's library and put them in target player's graveyard.

cards.name: Blazing Volley
cards.text: Blazing Volley deals 1 damage to each creature your opponents control.
cards.flavor: The arrows fell like fiery rain, and for a moment, the sky itself seemed to burn.
cards.originalText: Blazing Volley deals 1 damage to each creature your opponents control.

cards.name: Frogmite
cards.text: Affinity for artifacts (This spell costs {1} less to cast for each artifact you control.)
cards.flavor: At first, vedalken observers thought blinkmoths naturally avoided certain places. Then they realized those places were frogmite feeding grounds.
cards.originalText: Affinity for artifacts (This spell costs {1} less to cast for each artifact you control.)

cards.name: Minamo Scrollkeeper
cards.text:
Defender
Your maximum hand size is increased by one.
cards.flavor: The scrollkeepers never stepped an inch away from the doors of the Great Library, not even when the ogres and their oni masters swept through Minamo.

rulings.text: If multiple effects modify your hand size, apply them in timestamp order. For example, if you put Null Profusion (an enchantment that says your maximum hand size is two) onto the battlefield and then put Minamo Scrollkeeper onto the battlefield, your maximum hand size will be three. However, if those permanents entered the battlefield in the opposite order, your maximum hand size would be two.

cards.originalText:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
Your maximum hand size is increased by one.

cards.name: Angelic Renewal
cards.text: Whenever a creature is put into your graveyard from the battlefield, you may sacrifice Angelic Renewal. If you do, return that card to the battlefield.

rulings.text: If multiple creatures go to the graveyard at once, Angelic Renewal triggers multiple times, but it can only be sacrificed once and only brings back one creature.

If this card goes to the graveyard at the same time as a creature or sometime between when the creature left the battlefield and when the triggered ability resolves, then you will not be able to sacrifice this card and the creature can't be returned to the battlefield.
If an animated permanent that's not normally a creature is put into your graveyard from the battlefield, Angelic Renewal can return that card to the battlefield.
If a token creature is put into your graveyard from the battlefield, you can sacrifice Angelic Renewal, but nothing will be returned to the battlefield.

cards.originalText: If any creatures are put into your graveyard from play, you may bury Angelic Renewal and put one of those creatures into play.

cards.name: Strata Scythe

rulings.text: The bonus counts all lands on the battlefield with the same name as the exiled card, not just lands you control.

cards.name: Abeyance
cards.text:
Until end of turn, target player can't cast instant or sorcery spells, and that player can't activate abilities that aren't mana abilities.
Draw a card.
cards.flavor:
"I'm too modest a wizard to reveal the full extent of my abilities."
—Ertai, wizard adept

rulings.text: Abeyance prohibits activated abilities of cards which are not on the battlefield.
Abeyance never prevents mana abilities from being activated.
Abeyance does not affect abilities which are not activated, such as static abilities and triggered abilities. It also doesn't stop the declaration of attackers or blockers.
This can't be used as a counterspell. It will have no effect on spells which were on the stack when it was cast, nor on those cast in response to it.

cards.originalText:
Until end of turn, target player cannot play instants, interrupts, sorceries, or abilities requiring an activation cost.
Draw a card.

cards.name: Forest
cards.originalText: {T}: Add {G} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Prosperity
cards.text: Each player draws X cards.
cards.flavor: "Life can never be too good."

rulings.text: If both players run out of cards during this effect, the game is a draw.

cards.originalText: Each player draws X cards.

cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature can't attack or block.
{3}{W}{W}, Sacrifice Choking Restraints: Exile enchanted creature.
cards.originalText:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature can't attack or block.

Whenever Ink-Eyes, Servant of Oni deals combat damage to a player, you may put target creature card from that player's graveyard onto the battlefield under your control.
{1}{B}: Regenerate Ink-Eyes.

rulings.text: If, during the combat damage step, a creature is destroyed during combat and Ink-Eyes also deals combat damage to a player, the destroyed creature can be a legal target for Ink-Eyes's ability.

cards.name: Chaplain's Blessing
cards.text: You gain 5 life.
cards.flavor: "There was a time when the purpose of the church was to heal and protect. I would see that time return."
cards.originalText: You gain 5 life.

cards.name: Lightning Bolt
cards.text: Lightning Bolt deals 3 damage to any target.
cards.flavor: The sparkmage shrieked, calling on the rage of the storms of his youth. To his surprise, the sky responded with a fierce energy he'd never thought to see again.
cards.originalText: Lightning Bolt deals 3 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Ordruun Commando
cards.text: {W}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to Ordruun Commando this turn.
cards.flavor: Thick of muscle, stout of heart, and possessing a burning love of justice and the battlefield, the Ordruun minotaurs are the foundation of the Boros Legion.
cards.originalText: {W}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to Ordruun Commando this turn.

cards.name: Solidarity
cards.text: Creatures you control get +0/+5 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"We must all hang together, or assuredly we shall all hang separately."
—Benjamin Franklin
cards.originalText: Creatures you control get +0/+5 until end of turn.

cards.name: Goblin General

cards.flavor: Lead, follow, or run around like crazy.
cards.originalText: When Goblin General attacks, all your Goblins get +1/+1 until the end of the turn.

cards.name: Hope Against Hope
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+1 for each creature you control.
As long as enchanted creature is a Human, it has first strike.
cards.flavor: "I have given my life to the church, my soul to Avacyn, and my heart to the people."

rulings.text: Hope Against Hope's second ability counts the enchanted creature, so that creature will normally get at least +1/+1.

cards.originalText:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+1 for each creature you control.
As long as enchanted creature is a Human, it has first strike.

cards.name: Brainstorm
cards.text: Draw three cards, then put two cards from your hand on top of your library in any order.
cards.flavor:
"I see more than others do because I know where to look."
—Saprazzan vizier

rulings.text: You draw three cards and put two cards back all while Brainstorm is resolving. Nothing can happen between the two, and no player may choose to take actions.

cards.originalText: Draw three cards, then put two cards from your hand on top of your library in any order.

cards.originalText: When Ghoulraiser enters the battlefield, return a Zombie card at random from your graveyard to your hand.

Flying
Whenever an opponent draws a card, you may draw two cards.
cards.flavor: Blessed by the hands of Jin-Gitaxias.

rulings.text: You may either draw two cards or not draw at all. You can't choose to draw only one card.
The ability triggers once for each card an opponent draws. You choose whether to draw two cards as each of those abilities resolves.
If each player controls a Consecrated Sphinx, their abilities will cause each other to trigger until one player chooses not to draw cards.

cards.text:

rulings.text: A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature can attack, and its {T} abilities can be activated, only if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of their most recent turn. It doesn't matter how long the permanent has been a creature.
Lands that enter the battlefield or otehrwise come under your control after Rude Awakening resolves won't be affected.

cards.originalText: When Trostani's Summoner enters the battlefield, put a 2/2 white Knight creature token with vigilance, a 3/3 green Centaur creature token, and a 4/4 green Rhino creature token with trample onto the battlefield.

cards.name: Griffin Rider
cards.text: As long as you control a Griffin creature, Griffin Rider gets +3/+3 and has flying.
cards.flavor: After fighting alongside the griffin riders, older knights of Thune learned to admire a mount that could rip an enemy to shreds in seconds.
cards.originalText: As long as you control a Griffin creature, Griffin Rider gets +3/+3 and has flying.

cards.name: Roar of the Crowd
cards.text: Choose a creature type. Roar of the Crowd deals damage to any target equal to the number of permanents you control of the chosen type.
cards.flavor: One voice is but a pebble to the rest of the world. A thousand voices at once is an avalanche.

rulings.text: Note that this spell counts the number of permanents you control of the chosen type, not just the number of creatures you control. It will also take your tribal permanents into account.
You choose a target for this spell as you cast it, but you don't choose a creature type until the spell resolves.
Spells and abilities that prevent damage or regenerate the targeted creature must be cast or activated before the creature type is chosen.

cards.originalText: Choose a creature type. Roar of the Crowd deals damage to target creature or player equal to the number of permanents you control of the chosen type.

cards.name: Vivid Marsh
cards.text:
Vivid Marsh enters the battlefield tapped with two charge counters on it.
{T}: Add {B}.
{T}, Remove a charge counter from Vivid Marsh: Add one mana of any color.
cards.originalText:
Vivid Marsh enters the battlefield tapped with two charge counters on it.
{T}: Add {B} to your mana pool.
{T}, Remove a charge counter from Vivid Marsh: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.

cards.name: Fault Line
cards.text: Fault Line deals X damage to each creature without flying and each player.
cards.flavor:
We live on the serpent's back.
—Viashino saying
cards.originalText: Fault Line deals X damage to each creature without flying and each player.

cards.name: Melt Terrain
cards.text: Destroy target land. Melt Terrain deals 2 damage to that land's controller.
cards.flavor: Just as the most finely wrought metal can warp and rust, so too does Mirrodin buckle under pressures from without and within.

rulings.text: If the targeted land is an illegal target by the time Melt Terrain resolves, the spell won't resolve. No damage will be dealt.

cards.originalText: Destroy target land. Melt Terrain deals 2 damage to that land's controller.

cards.name: Hypnotic Specter
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever Hypnotic Specter deals damage to an opponent, that player discards a card at random.
cards.flavor:
"...There was no trace/ Of aught on that illumined face..."
—Samuel Coleridge, "Phantom"

rulings.text: The ability triggers even if the Specter's damage is being redirected to an opponent. It does not trigger if damage that would have been dealt to the opponent is redirected to a nonopponent player or a creature, or if the damage is prevented.

cards.source: SQUARE EDGES AND GOLD-BORDERED BACKSIDE, NOT TOURNAMENT LEGAL

cards.name: Black Knight
cards.text:
First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
Protection from white (This creature can't be blocked, targeted, dealt damage, or enchanted by anything white.)
cards.flavor: Battle doesn't need a purpose; the battle is its own purpose. You don't ask why a plague spreads or a field burns. Don't ask why I fight.
cards.originalText: Protection from white, first strike

cards.name: Bloodbond March
cards.text: Whenever a player casts a creature spell, each player returns all cards with the same name as that spell from their graveyard to the battlefield.
cards.flavor: The Golgari support a vast army because death never ends its soldiers' service.
cards.originalText: Whenever a creature spell is played, each player returns all cards with the same name as that spell from his or her graveyard to play.

cards.name: Will-o'-the-Wisp
cards.text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
{B}: Regenerate Will-o'-the-Wisp. (The next time this creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)
cards.flavor:
"About, about in reel and rout
The death-fires danced at night;
The water, like a witch's oils,
Burnt green, and blue and white."
—Samuel Coleridge, "The Rime of the Ancient Mariner"
cards.source: SQUARE EDGES AND GOLD-BORDERED BACKSIDE, NOT TOURNAMENT LEGAL

cards.name: Wall of Frost
cards.text:
Defender
Whenever Wall of Frost blocks a creature, that creature doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step.
cards.flavor:
"I welcome it. The pasture is cleared of weeds and the wolves are frozen solid."
—Lumi, goatherd

rulings.text: Wall of Frost's ability tracks the creature, not the creature's controller. That is, if the creature changes controllers before its first controller's next untap step, then it won't untap during its new controller's next untap step.

If the creature isn't tapped during its controller's next untap step (perhaps because it was untapped by a spell), Wall of Frost's ability has no effect at that time. It won't try to keep the creature tapped on subsequent turns.

cards.originalText:
Defender
Whenever Wall of Frost blocks a creature, that creature doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step.

cards.name: Start
cards.text: Create two 1/1 white Warrior creature tokens with vigilance.

rulings.text: Split cards with aftermath have a new frame treatment—the half you can cast from your hand is oriented the same as other cards you'd cast from your hand, while the half you can cast from your graveyard is a traditional split card half. This frame treatment is for your convenience and has no rules significance.

All split cards have two card faces on a single card, and you put a split card onto the stack with only the half you're casting. The characteristics of the half of the card you didn't cast are ignored while the spell is on the stack. For example, if an effect prevents you from casting green spells, you can cast Destined of Destined // Lead, but not Lead.

Each split card is a single card. For example, if you discard one, you've discarded one card, not two. If an effect counts the number of instant and sorcery cards in your graveyard, Destined // Lead counts once, not twice.
Each split card has two names. If an effect instructs you to choose a card name, you may choose one, but not both.

While not on the stack, the characteristics of a split card are the combination of its two halves. For example, Destined // Lead is a green and black card, it is both an instant card and a sorcery card, and its converted mana cost is 6. This means that if an effect allows you to cast a card with converted mana cost 2 from your hand, you can't cast Destined. This is a change from the previous rules for split cards.

If you cast the first half of a split card with aftermath during your turn, you'll have priority immediately after it resolves. You can cast the half with aftermath from your graveyard before any player can take any other action if it's legal for you to do so.
If another effect allows you to cast a split card with aftermath from any zone other than a graveyard, you can't cast the half with aftermath.

If another effect allows you to cast a split card with aftermath from a graveyard, you may cast either half. If you cast the half that has aftermath, you'll exile the card if it would leave the stack.
A spell with aftermath cast from a graveyard will always be exiled afterward, whether it resolves, it's countered, or it leaves the stack in some other way.

cards.originalText: Create two 1/1 white Warrior creature tokens with vigilance.

cards.text: Whenever a creature you control deals combat damage, you gain that much life.
cards.flavor: Fighting for the right reason is itself a source of strength.

cards.name: Ogre Taskmaster

cards.name: Soul of Shandalar
cards.text:
First strike
{3}{R}{R}: Soul of Shandalar deals 3 damage to target player or planeswalker and 3 damage to up to one target creature that player or that planeswalker's controller controls.
{3}{R}{R}, Exile Soul of Shandalar from your graveyard: Soul of Shandalar deals 3 damage to target player or planeswalker and 3 damage to up to one target creature that player or that planeswalker's controller controls.

rulings.text: You can activate the last ability only if the Soul is in your graveyard.
Exiling the Soul from your graveyard is part of the last ability's activation cost. A player can't remove the Soul in response to prevent you from activating the ability.
To activate either ability, you must target a player, but you can choose to not target any creatures.

cards.flavor: Some of the eleven minotaur clans of Mirtiin are expert crafters and learned philosophers. Others just like to hit stuff.

foreignNames.name: 血まみれ角のミノタウルス

cards.originalText: Bloodthirst 2 (If an opponent was dealt damage this turn, this creature enters the battlefield with two +1/+1 counters on it.)

cards.name: Impulse
cards.text: Look at the top four cards of your library. Put one of them into your hand and the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.

rulings.text: This is not a draw.
Due to errata, you no longer shuffle your library.

cards.name: Martial Coup
cards.text: Create X 1/1 white Soldier creature tokens. If X is 5 or more, destroy all other creatures.
cards.flavor: Their war forgotten, the nations of Bant stood united in the face of a common threat.

rulings.text: Martial Coup checks the number you chose for X, not the amount of mana you actually spent.
You do what the spell says in order. If X is 5 or more, you'll put the Soldier tokens onto the battlefield, then you'll destroy all other creatures.

No one can cast spells or activate abilities between the time the Soldier tokens are put onto the battlefield and the time all other creatures are destroyed. For example, you can't sacrifice one of those Soldier tokens to regenerate a Skeletal Kathari.

cards.originalText: Put X 1/1 white Soldier creature tokens onto the battlefield. If X is 5 or more, destroy all other creatures.

cards.name: Kitsune Mystic
cards.text: At the beginning of the end step, if Kitsune Mystic is enchanted by two or more Auras, flip it.
cards.originalText: At end of turn, if Kitsune Mystic is enchanted by two or more enchantments, flip it.

cards.name: Elvish Bard
cards.text: All creatures able to block Elvish Bard do so.
cards.originalText: All creatures able to block Elvish Bard do so.

cards.name: Thrill-Kill Assassin
cards.text:
Deathtouch
Unleash (You may have this creature enter the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it. It can't block as long as it has a +1/+1 counter on it.)
cards.flavor: As the bounty on Massacre Girl rose, so did the number of imitators.

rulings.text: You make the choice to have the creature with unleash enter the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter or not as it's entering the battlefield. At that point, it's too late for a player to respond to the creature spell by trying to counter it, for example.
The unleash ability applies no matter where the creature is entering the battlefield from.
A creature with unleash can't block if it has any +1/+1 counter on it, not just one put on it by the unleash ability.
Putting a +1/+1 counter on a creature with unleash that's already blocking won't remove it from combat. It will continue to block.

cards.originalText:
Deathtouch
Unleash (You may have this creature enter the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it. It can't block as long as it has a +1/+1 counter on it.)

cards.name: Goblin Dynamo
cards.text:
{T}: Goblin Dynamo deals 1 damage to any target.
{X}{R}, {T}, Sacrifice Goblin Dynamo: It deals X damage to any target.
cards.originalText:
{T}: Goblin Dynamo deals 1 damage to target creature or player.
{X}{R}, {T}, Sacrifice Goblin Dynamo: Goblin Dynamo deals X damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Vicious Kavu
cards.text: Whenever Vicious Kavu attacks, it gets +2/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: As battle raged in Shiv, a strange new ally appeared from below the ravaged ground.
cards.originalText: Whenever Vicious Kavu attacks, it gets +2/+0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Baloth Cage Trap
cards.text:
If an opponent had an artifact enter the battlefield under their control this turn, you may pay {1}{G} rather than pay this spell's mana cost.
Create a 4/4 green Beast creature token.

rulings.text: You may ignore a Trap's alternative cost condition and simply cast it for its normal mana cost. This is true even if its alternative cost condition has been met.
Casting a Trap by paying its alternative cost doesn't change its mana cost or converted mana cost. The only difference is the cost you actually pay.
Effects that increase or reduce the cost to cast a Trap will apply to whichever cost you chose to pay.

cards.originalText:
If an opponent had an artifact enter the battlefield under his or her control this turn, you may pay {1}{G} rather than pay Baloth Cage Trap's mana cost.
Create a 4/4 green Beast creature token.

cards.name: Mesa Pegasus
cards.text: Flying; banding (Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding you control are blocking or being blocked by a creature, you divide that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking.)
cards.flavor: Before a woman marries in the village of Sursi, she must visit the land of the Mesa Pegasus. Legend has it that if the woman is pure of heart and her love is true, a Mesa Pegasus will appear, blessing her family with long life and good fortune.

rulings.text: If a creature with banding attacks, it can team up with any number of other attacking creatures with banding (and up to one nonbanding creature) and attack as a unit called a "band." The band can be blocked by any creature that could block a single creature in the band. Blocking any creature in a band blocks the entire band. If a creature with banding is blocked, the attacking player chooses how the blockers' damage is assigned.
A maximum of one nonbanding creature can join an attacking band no matter how many creatures with banding are in it.
Creatures in the same band must all attack the same player or planeswalker.
If a creature in combat has banding, its controller assigns damage for creatures blocking or blocked by it. That player can ignore the damage assignment order when making this assignment.

cards.originalText: Flying, bands

cards.name: Cephalid Snitch
cards.text: Sacrifice Cephalid Snitch: Target creature loses protection from black until end of turn.
cards.flavor: The cautious are wary of their enemies. The wise are also wary of their friends.
cards.originalText: Sacrifice Cephalid Snitch: Target creature loses protection from black until end of turn.

cards.name: Akki Blizzard-Herder
cards.text: When Akki Blizzard-Herder dies, each player sacrifices a land.
cards.flavor:
"It remains unclear whether the akki shamans could in fact create storms or simply predicted them."
—The History of Kamigawa
cards.originalText: When Akki Blizzard-Herder is put into a graveyard from play, each player sacrifices a land.

cards.name: Charge Across the Araba
cards.text: Sweep — Return any number of Plains you control to their owner's hand. Creatures you control get +1/+1 until end of turn for each Plains returned this way.
cards.originalText: Sweep Return any number of Plains you control to their owner's hand. Creatures you control get +1/+1 until end of turn for each Plains returned this way.

cards.name: Final Punishment
cards.text: Target player loses life equal to the damage already dealt to that player this turn.
cards.flavor: The pain of a lifetime—every scrape, illness, and bruise—condensed into a single moment.

rulings.text: Damage that is prevented does not count toward the total.

cards.originalText: Target player loses life equal to the damage already dealt to him or her this turn.

cards.name: Jungle Patrol
cards.text:
{1}{G}, {T}: Create a 0/1 green Wall creature token with defender named Wood.
Sacrifice a token named Wood: Add {R}.
cards.originalText:
{1}{G}, {T}: Put a Wood token into play. Treat this token as a 0/1 green creature that counts as a Wall.
Sacrifice a Wood token: Add {R} to your mana pool. Play this ability as a mana source.

cards.name: Tivadar's Crusade
cards.text: Destroy all Goblins.
cards.originalText: Destroy all Goblins.

cards.name: Sure Strike
cards.text: Target creature gets +3/+0 and gains first strike until end of turn. (It deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
cards.flavor: To survive imminent doom, it sometimes takes a foolhardy soul who acts first and fears later.
cards.originalText: Target creature gets +3/+0 and gains first strike until end of turn. (It deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)

cards.name: Sunscorch Regent
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever an opponent casts a spell, put a +1/+1 counter on Sunscorch Regent and you gain 1 life.
cards.flavor:
"We trust in the scalelords, bringers of justice that none can escape."
—Urdnan, Dromoka warrior
cards.originalText:
Flying
Whenever an opponent casts a spell, put a +1/+1 counter on Sunscorch Regent and you gain 1 life.

cards.name: Forgotten Ancient
cards.text:
Whenever a player casts a spell, you may put a +1/+1 counter on Forgotten Ancient.
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may move any number of +1/+1 counters from Forgotten Ancient onto other creatures.
cards.flavor: Its blood is life. Its body is growth.

rulings.text: It does not get counters for copies of spells (as with Storm), just for spells that are actually cast.
The moving of counters is not a targeted ability.
You decide how many counters to move and where to move them when the ability resolves.
Putting on a counter is optional. If you forget to do so, it means you chose not to do so.

cards.originalText:
Whenever a player plays a spell, you may put a +1/+1 counter on Forgotten Ancient.
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may move any number of +1/+1 counters from Forgotten Ancient onto other creatures.

cards.name: Serum Powder
cards.text:
{T}: Add {C}.
Any time you could mulligan and Serum Powder is in your hand, you may exile all the cards from your hand, then draw that many cards. (You can do this in addition to taking mulligans.)

rulings.text: You can use Serum Powder's second ability only while it's in your hand. If this card is in your hand, you can choose either to mulligan or to use Serum Powder's ability. Using the ability doesn't prevent you from taking further mulligans, and taking a mulligan doesn't prevent you from using a Serum Powder's ability if you happen to draw one in your new hand.

Unlike a normal mulligan, Serum Powder lets you draw the same number of cards that were in your hand, not one less. If you have already taken one mulligan and your hand contains six cards including a Serum Powder, you can choose to exile those six cards and draw six new cards.

The cards in your hand are exiled for the rest of the game; they aren't shuffled back into your library if you take another mulligan. Cards exiled are always face up unless the effect that exiled them says they aren't. Be sure to return those cards to your deck for your next game.

cards.originalText:
{T}: Add {C} to your mana pool.
Any time you could mulligan and Serum Powder is in your hand, you may exile all the cards from your hand, then draw that many cards. (You can do this in addition to taking mulligans.)

cards.name: Skirk Shaman
cards.setName: Duel Decks Anthology, Elves vs. Goblins
cards.text: Skirk Shaman can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or red creatures.
cards.flavor: In a shaman's grimy hands, a concoction of dried Skirk Ridge herbs can become the face of panic.

rulings.text: This is the timeshifted version of Severed Legion.

cards.originalText: Skirk Shaman can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or red creatures.

cards.name: Altar's Reap
cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, sacrifice a creature.
Draw two cards.
cards.flavor:
"Don't worry, your death will be as informative as possible."
—Gorghul, augur of skulls

rulings.text: You must sacrifice exactly one creature to cast this spell; you cannot cast it without sacrificing a creature, and you cannot sacrifice additional creatures.
Players can only respond once this spell has been cast and all its costs have been paid. No one can try to destroy the creature you sacrificed to prevent you from casting this spell.

cards.originalText:
As an additional cost to cast Altar's Reap, sacrifice a creature.
Draw two cards.

cards.name: Inquisition of Kozilek
cards.text: Target player reveals their hand. You choose a nonland card from it with converted mana cost 3 or less. That player discards that card.
cards.flavor: You will scream out your innermost secrets just to make it stop.

rulings.text: If you target yourself with this spell, you must reveal your entire hand to the other players just as any other player would.

cards.originalText: Target player reveals his or her hand. You choose a nonland card from it with converted mana cost 3 or less. That player discards that card.

cards.name: Dissipate
cards.text: Counter target spell. If that spell is countered this way, exile it instead of putting it into its owner's graveyard.

rulings.text: The card does not go to the graveyard before being exiled.
If the spell is not countered (because the spell it targets can't be countered), then it does not get exiled.

cards.name: Phantom Warrior
cards.text: Phantom Warrior can't be blocked.
cards.flavor: It can pass through solid matter—but that doesn't mean it's harmless.
cards.originalText: Phantom Warrior is unblockable.

cards.name: Megrim
cards.text: Whenever an opponent discards a card, Megrim deals 2 damage to that player.
cards.flavor:
"Pain is both a tool and a craft. Like any tool, it must be sharpened. Like any craft, it must be practiced."
—Hooks, Cabal torturer
cards.originalText: Whenever an opponent discards a card, Megrim deals 2 damage to that player.

cards.name: Emperor Crocodile
cards.text: When you control no other creatures, sacrifice Emperor Crocodile.
cards.flavor: The king of Yavimaya's waters pays constant attention to his subjects . . . and thrives on their adulation.

rulings.text: Emperor Crocodile's ability will trigger if you don't control another creature, even if it's only for a brief moment during the resolution of another spell or ability (such as that of Brago, King Eternal).
The ability only checks if you control no other creatures at the time it triggers. It does not check again on resolution, so gaining control of a creature before then will not save Emperor Crocodile.

cards.originalText: When you control no other creatures, sacrifice Emperor Crocodile.

cards.name: Mystic Snake
cards.text:
Flash
When Mystic Snake enters the battlefield, counter target spell.
cards.flavor: Its fangs are in your flesh before its hiss leaves your ears.
cards.originalText:
Flash
When Mystic Snake enters the battlefield, counter target spell.

cards.name: Island
cards.originalText: U

cards.name: Degavolver
cards.text:
Kicker {1}{B} and/or {R} (You may pay an additional {1}{B} and/or {R} as you cast this spell.)
If Degavolver was kicked with its {1}{B} kicker, it enters the battlefield with two +1/+1 counters on it and with "Pay 3 life: Regenerate Degavolver."
If Degavolver was kicked with its {R} kicker, it enters the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it and with first strike.

cards.name: Monastery Loremaster
cards.text:
Megamorph {5}{U} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its megamorph cost and put a +1/+1 counter on it.)
When Monastery Loremaster is turned face up, return target noncreature, nonland card from your graveyard to your hand.

rulings.text: Turning a face-down creature with megamorph face up and putting a +1/+1 counter on it is a special action. It doesn't use the stack and can't be responded to.

If a face-down creature with megamorph is turned face up some other way (for example, if you manifest a card with megamorph and then pay its mana cost to turn it face up), you won't put a +1/+1 counter on it.
Megamorph is a variant of the morph ability. You can find more information on morph on cards with morph from the Khans of Tarkir set.

cards.originalText:
Megamorph {5}{U} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its megamorph cost and put a +1/+1 counter on it.)
When Monastery Loremaster is turned face up, return target noncreature, nonland card from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.name: Coffin Queen
cards.text:
You may choose not to untap Coffin Queen during your untap step.
{2}{B}, {T}: Put target creature card from a graveyard onto the battlefield under your control. When Coffin Queen becomes untapped or you lose control of Coffin Queen, exile that creature.

rulings.text: If the creature put onto the battlefield leaves the battlefield, the tracking effect ends and the creature will no longer be exiled if something happens to the Coffin Queen.

If the creature put onto the battlefield phases out, the tracking effect continues when it phases back in if the Coffin Queen is still on the battlefield. If the Queen left the battlefield while the creature was phased out, the creature phases in as normal.

If Coffin Queen leaves the battlefield before its ability resolves, the delayed trigger condition can never be fulfilled, so the creature will not be exiled. If Coffin Queen is untapped when its ability resolves, the creature will not be exiled until the next time Coffin Queen becomes untapped.

cards.originalText:
You may choose not to untap Coffin Queen during your untap step.
{2}{B}, {T}: Put target creature card from a graveyard onto the battlefield under your control. When Coffin Queen becomes untapped or you lose control of Coffin Queen, exile that creature.

cards.name: Mountain
cards.source: SQUARE EDGES AND GOLD-BORDERED BACKSIDE, NOT TOURNAMENT LEGAL

cards.name: Very Cryptic Command (f)
cards.text:
Choose two —
• Scry 3.
• Create a 2/2 black Rogue creature token with menace.
• Add or subtract 1 or one from a number or number word on target spell or permanent until end of turn.
• Return all artifacts target player controls to their owner's hand.
cards.originalText:
Choose two —
• Scry 3.
• Create a 2/2 black Rogue creature token with menace.
• Add or subtract 1 or one from a number or number word on target spell or permanent until end of turn.
• Return all artifacts target player controls to their owner's hand.

cards.name: Kodama's Reach
cards.text: Search your library for up to two basic land cards, reveal those cards, and put one onto the battlefield tapped and the other into your hand. Then shuffle your library.
cards.flavor:
"The land grows only where the kami will it."
—Dosan the Falling Leaf

rulings.text: You can get just one basic land card if you wish (or even none at all). If you get only one land card, you put it onto the battlefield tapped.

cards.originalText: Search your library for up to two basic land cards, reveal those cards, and put one onto the battlefield tapped and the other into your hand. Then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Serpent Warrior
cards.text: When Serpent Warrior enters the battlefield, you lose 3 life.
cards.flavor: A hiss before dying.

rulings.text: You can cast this if you have less than 3 life, since the life is lost as an effect and not a payment.

cards.originalText: When Serpent Warrior enters the battlefield, you lose 3 life.

cards.name: Vorosh, the Hunter
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever Vorosh, the Hunter deals combat damage to a player, you may pay {2}{G}. If you do, put six +1/+1 counters on Vorosh.
cards.originalText:
Flying
Whenever Vorosh, the Hunter deals combat damage to a player, you may pay {2}{G}. If you do, put six +1/+1 counters on Vorosh.

cards.name: Armed Response
cards.text: Armed Response deals damage to target attacking creature equal to the number of Equipment you control.
cards.flavor: Raksha watched as the goblins continued to pour onto the Razor Fields. "They just don't know when to stop, do they?"
cards.originalText: Armed Response deals damage to target attacking creature equal to the number of Equipment you control.

cards.name: Elvish Champion
cards.text: Other Elf creatures get +1/+1 and have forestwalk. (They can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Forest.)
cards.flavor:
"For what are leaves but countless blades
To fight a countless foe on high."
—Elvish hymn

rulings.text: It affects Elves controlled by all players, not just yours.
This card is now an Elf but has been reworded so that it does not give itself the bonus.

cards.originalText: All Elves get +1/+1 and have forestwalk. (They're unblockable as long as defending player controls a forest.)

cards.name: Scoured Barrens
cards.text:
Scoured Barrens enters the battlefield tapped.
When Scoured Barrens enters the battlefield, you gain 1 life.
{T}: Add {W} or {B}.
cards.originalText: Scoured Barrens enters the battlefield tapped.When Scoured Barrens enters the battlefield, you gain 1 life.{T}: Add {W} or {B} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Clinging Darkness
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets -4/-1.
cards.flavor: There's an experience worse than blindness—it's the certainty that your vision is perfect and the horror that there's no world around you to see.
cards.originalText:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets -4/-1.

cards.name: Nightfire Giant
cards.text:
Nightfire Giant gets +1/+1 as long as you control a Mountain.
{4}{R}: Nightfire Giant deals 2 damage to any target.
cards.flavor: Nightfire turns the greatest weakness of the undead into formidable strength.
cards.originalText:
Nightfire Giant gets +1/+1 as long as you control a Mountain.
{4}{R}: Nightfire Giant deals 2 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Stromgald Cabal
cards.text: {T}, Pay 1 life: Counter target white spell.
cards.flavor: When the alliance between Balduvia and Kjeldor deprived Stromgald of easy victories, its agents were forced to fuel their rituals with their own flesh.
cards.originalText: {T}, Pay 1 life: Counter target white spell. Play this ability as an interrupt.

cards.name: Tropical Island
cards.text: ({T}: Add {G} or {U}.)

rulings.text: This has the mana abilities associated with both of its basic land types.
This has basic land types, but it isn't a basic land. Things that affect basic lands don't affect it. Things that affect basic land types do.

cards.originalText: Counts as both forest and islands and is affected by spells that affect either. Tap to add either {G} or {U} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Bontu's Monument
cards.text:
Black creature spells you cast cost {1} less to cast.
Whenever you cast a creature spell, each opponent loses 1 life and you gain 1 life.
cards.flavor:
"The worthy shall strive for greatness. Supremacy in life leads to supremacy in the afterlife."
—Monument inscription

rulings.text: In a Two-Headed Giant game, the triggered ability of Bontu's Monument causes the opposing team to lose 2 life and you gain 1 life.

Each Monument has one ability that reduces the cost of creature spells of a certain color, and a triggered ability that triggers whenever you cast any creature spell—not just a creature spell of that color.

A creature spell that's multiple colors is each of those colors. For example, Ahn-Crop Champion is a white creature and a green creature, so it can benefit from either Oketra's Monument or Rhonas's Monument—or both at once.

To determine the total cost of a creature spell, start with the mana cost or alternative cost you're paying, add any cost increases, then apply any cost reductions. The converted mana cost of the creature remains unchanged, no matter what the total cost to cast it was.
Each Monument's triggered ability triggers as the creature spell is cast and resolves before that creature spell resolves. The ability will resolve even if that creature spell is countered.

cards.originalText:
Black creature spells you cast cost {1} less to cast.
Whenever you cast a creature spell, each opponent loses 1 life and you gain 1 life.

cards.name: New Benalia
cards.text:
New Benalia enters the battlefield tapped.
When New Benalia enters the battlefield, scry 1. (Look at the top card of your library. You may put that card on the bottom of your library.)
{T}: Add {W}.
cards.originalText:
New Benalia comes into play tapped.
When New Benalia comes into play, scry 1. (Look at the top card of your library, then you may put that card on the bottom of your library.)
{T}: Add {W} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Daretti, Scrap Savant
cards.text:
+2: Discard up to two cards, then draw that many cards.
−2: Sacrifice an artifact. If you do, return target artifact card from your graveyard to the battlefield.
−10: You get an emblem with "Whenever an artifact is put into your graveyard from the battlefield, return that card to the battlefield at the beginning of the next end step."
Daretti, Scrap Savant can be your commander.

rulings.text: You may choose to discard zero cards as the first ability resolves. In that case, you won't draw any cards.

You choose which artifact to sacrifice as the second ability resolves. You must sacrifice an artifact if you control at least one at that time. For example, if you control two artifacts when you activate the second ability, but the artifact you intended to sacrifice is destroyed in response, you must sacrifice the other artifact as the ability resolves.

The ability of Daretti's emblem will return the artifact card only if it's still in your graveyard when the delayed triggered ability resolves at the beginning of the next end step. If the artifact card left your graveyard before that point (even if it was put back into your graveyard), the ability won't return it to the battlefield.

foreignNames.name: 屑鉄の学者、ダレッティ

cards.originalText:
+2: Discard up to two cards, then draw that many cards.
−2: Sacrifice an artifact. If you do, return target artifact card from your graveyard to the battlefield.
−10: You get an emblem with "Whenever an artifact is put into your graveyard from the battlefield, return that card to the battlefield at the beginning of the next end step."
Daretti, Scrap Savant can be your commander.

cards.name: Pharika's Mender
cards.text: When Pharika's Mender enters the battlefield, you may return target creature or enchantment card from your graveyard to your hand.
cards.flavor: "The direst venom becomes a panacea under Pharika's guidance. I bring it to the worthy, clinging at the edge of the abyss."
cards.originalText: When Pharika's Mender enters the battlefield, you may return target creature or enchantment card from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.name: Negate
cards.text: Counter target noncreature spell.
cards.flavor: Masters of the arcane savor a delicious irony. Their study of deep and complex arcana leads to such a simple end: the ability to say merely yes or no.

rulings.text: A "creature spell" is any spell with the type creature, even if it has other types such as artifact or enchantment. Older cards of type summon are also creature spells.

cards.originalText: Counter target noncreature spell.

cards.name: Hellrider
cards.text:
Haste
Whenever a creature you control attacks, Hellrider deals 1 damage to the player or planeswalker it's attacking.
cards.flavor:
"Behind every devil's mayhem lurks a demon's scheme."
—Rem Karolus, Blade of the Inquisitors

rulings.text: Creatures you control may attack multiple players and/or planeswalkers. For each attacking creature, Hellrider will deal damage to the corresponding player or planeswalker.

cards.originalText:
Haste
Whenever a creature you control attacks, Hellrider deals 1 damage to defending player.

cards.name: Flowstone Hellion
cards.text:
Haste
{0}: Flowstone Hellion gets +1/-1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Volrath leaves no stone untrained.

rulings.text: It will be put into its owner's graveyard as soon as one of its abilities resolves that puts its toughness at zero (or less than the current amount of damage on it). This is a state-based action, so there is no way to activate its ability any more to increase its power further before it is put into the graveyard.

cards.originalText:
Flowstone Hellion is unaffected by summoning sickness.
{0}: Flowstone Hellion gets +1/-1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Soltari Trooper
cards.text:
Shadow (This creature can block or be blocked by only creatures with shadow.)
Whenever Soltari Trooper attacks, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"Dauthi blood is soltari wine."
—Soltari Tales of Life
cards.originalText:
Shadow (This creature can block or be blocked by only creatures with shadow.)
Whenever Soltari Trooper attacks, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Goblin Raider
cards.text: Goblin Raider can't block.
cards.flavor: He's smart for a goblin. He can do two things: hit and run.
cards.originalText: Goblin Raider can't block.

cards.name: Faithless Looting
cards.text:
Draw two cards, then discard two cards.
Flashback {2}{R} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)
cards.flavor: "Avacyn has abandoned us! We have nothing left except what we can take!"

rulings.text: You draw two cards and discard two cards all while Faithless Looting is resolving. Nothing can happen between the two, and no player may choose to take actions.

cards.originalText:
Draw two cards, then discard two cards.
Flashback {2}{R} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

cards.name: Ghostfire Blade
cards.flavor: If you fear the dragon's fire, you are unworthy to wield it.

rulings.text: Face-down creatures and most artifact creatures are colorless.

cards.name: Underground Sea
cards.text: ({T}: Add {U} or {B}.)

rulings.text: This has the mana abilities associated with both of its basic land types.
This has basic land types, but it isn't a basic land. Things that affect basic lands don't affect it. Things that affect basic land types do.

cards.originalText: Counts as both swamp and islands and is affected by spells that affect either. Tap to add either {B} or {U} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Smoldering Crater
cards.text:
Smoldering Crater enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {R}.
Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)

rulings.text: Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with cycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.

cards.originalText: Smoldering Crater enters the battlefield tapped.{T}: Add {R} to your mana pool.Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)

cards.name: Pontiff of Blight
cards.text:
Extort (Whenever you cast a spell, you may pay {W/B}. If you do, each opponent loses 1 life and you gain that much life.)
Other creatures you control have extort. (If a creature has multiple instances of extort, each triggers separately.)

rulings.text: You may pay {W/B} a maximum of one time for each extort triggered ability. You decide whether to pay when the ability resolves.

The amount of life you gain from extort is based on the total amount of life lost, not necessarily the number of opponents you have. For example, if your opponent's life total can't change (perhaps because that player controls Platinum Emperion), you won't gain any life.
The extort ability doesn't target any player.

cards.originalText:
Extort (Whenever you cast a spell, you may pay {W/B}. If you do, each opponent loses 1 life and you gain that much life.)
Other creatures you control have extort. (If a creature has multiple instances of extort, each triggers separately.)

cards.name: Stone Spirit
cards.text: Stone Spirit can't be blocked by creatures with flying.
cards.flavor:
"The spirit of the stone is the spirit of strength."
—Lovisa Coldeyes, Balduvian chieftain

rulings.text: Creatures with the Reach ability (such as Giant Spider) can block this because they don't actually have Flying.

cards.originalText: Stone Spirit can't be blocked by creatures with flying.

cards.name: Elesh Norn, Grand Cenobite
cards.text:
Vigilance
Other creatures you control get +2/+2.
Creatures your opponents control get -2/-2.
cards.flavor: "The Gitaxians whisper among themselves of other worlds. If they exist, we must bring Phyrexia's magnificence to them."

rulings.text: If a second Elesh Norn, Grand Cenobite comes under your control, you'll put one into its owner's graveyard due to the "legend rule" at the same time that any of your opponents' creatures getting -4/-4 are put into their owner's graveyard for having 0 or less toughness.

foreignNames.name: 大修道士、エリシュ・ノーン

cards.name: Quicksmith Genius
cards.text: Whenever an artifact enters the battlefield under your control, you may discard a card. If you do, draw a card.
cards.flavor: Quicksmiths are eager to jump from one project to the next, relying on flashes of inspiration rather than careful research.
cards.originalText: Whenever an artifact enters the battlefield under your control, you may discard a card. If you do, draw a card.

cards.name: Pay No Heed
cards.text: Prevent all damage a source of your choice would deal this turn.
cards.flavor: "My course is before me. There is nothing behind me."

rulings.text: Pay No Heed doesn't target anything. You can choose a source with hexproof, for example. You choose the damage source as Pay No Heed resolves.
If the chosen source is a permanent spell, damage dealt later in the turn by the permanent it becomes will also be prevented.

cards.originalText: Prevent all damage a source of your choice would deal this turn.

cards.name: Burnished Hart
cards.text: {3}, Sacrifice Burnished Hart: Search your library for up to two basic land cards, put them onto the battlefield tapped, then shuffle your library.
cards.flavor: Forged by divine hands to wander mortal realms.
cards.originalText: {3}, Sacrifice Burnished Hart: Search your library for up to two basic land cards, put them onto the battlefield tapped, then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Deadeye Harpooner
cards.text: Revolt — When Deadeye Harpooner enters the battlefield, if a permanent you controlled left the battlefield this turn, destroy target tapped creature an opponent controls.
cards.flavor: "It seems there's even better hunting down here."

rulings.text: Revolt abilities check only whether a permanent you controlled left the battlefield this turn or not. They don't apply multiple times if more than one permanent you controlled left the battlefield. They don't check whether the permanent that left the battlefield is still in the zone it moved to.

Revolt abilities don't care why the permanent left the battlefield, who caused it to move, or where it moved to. They're equally satisfied by an artifact you sacrificed to pay a cost, a creature you controlled that was destroyed by Murder, or an enchantment you returned to your hand with Leave in the Dust.
Tokens that leave the battlefield will satisfy a revolt ability.
Energy counters aren't permanents. Paying {E} won't satisfy a revolt ability.

All cards in the Aether Revolt set with triggered revolt abilities use an intervening "if" clause. A permanent you controlled must have left the battlefield earlier in the turn in order for these abilities to trigger; otherwise they do nothing. In other words, there's no way to have the ability trigger if no permanent you controlled has left the battlefield that turn, even if you intend to have one do so in response to the triggered ability.

cards.originalText: Revolt — When Deadeye Harpooner enters the battlefield, if a permanent you controlled left the battlefield this turn, destroy target tapped creature an opponent controls.

cards.name: Vedalken Engineer
cards.text: {T}: Add two mana of any one color. Spend this mana only to cast artifact spells or activate abilities of artifacts.
cards.flavor: Art is unknown to the vedalken—for them, all creations must serve a purpose.

foreignNames.name: ヴィダルケンの技術者

cards.originalText: {T}: Add two mana of any one color to your mana pool. Spend this mana only to cast artifact spells or activate abilities of artifacts.

cards.name: Murkfiend Liege
cards.text:
Other green creatures you control get +1/+1.
Other blue creatures you control get +1/+1.
Untap all green and/or blue creatures you control during each other player's untap step.

rulings.text: The abilities are separate and cumulative. If another creature you control is both of the listed colors, it will get a total of +2/+2.
All your green and/or blue creatures untap during each other player's untap step. You have no choice about what untaps. Those creatures untap at the same time as the active player's permanents.

During each other player's untap step, effects that would otherwise cause your green and/or blue creatures to stay tapped don't apply because they only apply during *your* untap step. For example, if you control Nettle Sentinel (a green creature that says "Nettle Sentinel doesn't untap during your untap step"), you untap it during each other player's untap step.
Multiple Murkfiend Lieges are redundant when it comes to the untap effect. You can't untap your permanents more than once in a single untap step.

cards.originalText: Other green creatures you control get +1/+1.Other blue creatures you control get +1/+1.Untap all green and/or blue creatures you control during each other player's untap step.

cards.name: Vulshok Heartstoker
cards.text: When Vulshok Heartstoker enters the battlefield, target creature gets +2/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: He fashions stirring words with as much passion as a smith fashioning a warhammer.

foreignNames.name: ヴァルショクの心臓焚き

cards.originalText: When Vulshok Heartstoker enters the battlefield, target creature gets +2/+0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Vedalken Anatomist
cards.text: {2}{U}, {T}: Put a -1/-1 counter on target creature. You may tap or untap that creature.
cards.flavor: "Specimen 211 examination report. Observation: graft sublimation incomplete. Result: death. Prepare specimen 212."

rulings.text: If the creature is an illegal target when the ability tries to resolve, it won't resolve. None of its effects happen.

foreignNames.name: ヴィダルケンの解剖学者

cards.originalText: {2}{U}, {T}: Put a -1/-1 counter on target creature. You may tap or untap that creature.

cards.name: Juvenile Gloomwidow
cards.text:
Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
Wither (This deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters.)
cards.flavor: Gloomwidow venom is particularly virulent during the spider's first years, when it does most of its hunting near the forest floor.
cards.originalText:
Reach (This can block creatures with flying.)
Wither (This deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters.)

cards.name: Urza's Power Plant
cards.text: {T}: Add {C}. If you control an Urza's Mine and an Urza's Tower, add {C}{C} instead.
cards.flavor: Artifact construction requires immense resources.

rulings.text: If you have at least one of each of the three Urza's lands on the battlefield, you must take the 2 mana instead of just one.

cards.originalText: {T}: Add {1} to your mana pool. If you control an Urza's Mine and an Urza's Tower, add {2} to your mana pool instead.

cards.name: Gruul Guildgate
cards.text:
Gruul Guildgate enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {R} or {G}.
cards.flavor: Enter and leave the shackles of society behind.

rulings.text: The subtype Gate has no special rules significance, but other spells and abilities may refer to it.
Gate is not a basic land type.

foreignNames.name: Porte de la guilde de Gruul

cards.originalText: Gruul Guildgate enters the battlefield tapped.{T}: Add {R} or {G} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Harmonic Sliver
cards.text: All Slivers have "When this permanent enters the battlefield, destroy target artifact or enchantment."
cards.flavor:
"Since the last sliver arrived, even our mightiest relics splinter into shards as soon as we bring them against the hive."
—Llanach, Skyshroud ranger

rulings.text: The controller of the Sliver that enters the battlefield, not the controller of Harmonic Sliver, chooses the target.
This ability will trigger when Harmonic Sliver enters the battlefield.

Abilities that Slivers grant, as well as power/toughness boosts, are cumulative. However, for some abilities, like flying, having more than one instance of the ability doesn't provide any additional benefit.
If the creature type of a Sliver changes so it's no longer a Sliver, it will no longer be affected by its own ability. Its ability will continue to affect other Sliver creatures.

cards.originalText: All Slivers have "When this creature comes into play, destroy target artifact or enchantment."

cards.name: Counsel of the Soratami
cards.text: Draw two cards.
cards.flavor: "Wisdom is not the counting of all the drops in a waterfall. Wisdom is learning why the water seeks the earth."
cards.originalText: Draw two cards.

cards.name: Rakeclaw Gargantuan
cards.text: {1}: Target creature with power 5 or greater gains first strike until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Naya teems with gargantuans, titanic monsters to whom both nature and civilization defer.

rulings.text: The ability checks the targeted creature's power twice: when the creature becomes the target, and when the ability resolves. Once the ability resolves, it will continue to apply to the affected creature no matter what its power may become later in the turn.

foreignNames.name: 熊手爪のガルガンチュアン

cards.originalText: {1}: Target creature with power 5 or greater gains first strike until end of turn.

cards.name: Cloudshift
cards.text: Exile target creature you control, then return that card to the battlefield under your control.
cards.flavor:
"Even storm clouds bow to worship Avacyn."
—Elder Rimheit

rulings.text: Once the exiled permanent returns, it's considered a new object with no relation to the object that it was. Auras attached to the exiled permanent will be put into their owners' graveyards. Equipment attached to the exiled permanent will become unattached and remain on the battlefield. Any counters on the exiled permanent will cease to exist.
The returned card won't be the target of any spells or abilities that targeted it before. Any spells that don't target, such as Akroma's Vengeance, will still affect it.
If a token is exiled this way, it will cease to exist and won't return to the battlefield.

When an effect returns the exiled card "under your control," you control it indefinitely after that. In a multiplayer game, if a player leaves the game, all cards that player owns leave as well. If you leave the game, any creatures you control from Cloudshift's effect are exiled.

cards.originalText: Exile target creature you control, then return that card to the battlefield under your control.

cards.name: Ranger of Eos
cards.text: When Ranger of Eos enters the battlefield, you may search your library for up to two creature cards with converted mana cost 1 or less, reveal them, and put them into your hand. If you do, shuffle your library.
cards.flavor: At his side, humble beasts become weapons more deadly than sharpened steel.

rulings.text: You may choose to find zero, one, or two creature cards in your library. Each card you find must have converted mana cost 1 or less.

foreignNames.name: イーオスのレインジャー

cards.originalText: When Ranger of Eos comes into play, you may search your library for up to two creature cards with converted mana cost 1 or less, reveal them, and put them into your hand. If you do, shuffle your library.
